page.title: 09Religion in Ripe
page.content: The area has two Church of England churches and one Rector who has a large parish with one other church in nearby Laughton to care for. At one time each little village had its own resident vicar but all that has changed in the last fifty years. In 1938 the parishes of Chalvington and Ripe were joined. Then as recently as 1978 the village of Laughton was added and our present Rector has a widespread parish including services held in the three villages and Deanland Wood Caravan Park. Services are held at 8.0am Holy Communion, 11 am Matins and Holy Communion and 6.30pm Evensong. Sunday School is held on alternate Sundays for the little children. Bible reading fellowship is held in the home of a church member. The other sects go to Eastbourne.
